visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.

useSnapshot.helpDescription:
Determines the behavior when reset is executed.
Note: This property is only relevant if no variant management is used, and the filter bar is not used in the advanced mode. A snapshot shows the current state of the filter bar, just before the Filters dialog is opened.
  • undefined (default) defines the standard behavior: snapshot will be applied after reset was triggered
  • false defines that the snapshot will not be applied
  • trueis not considered at all
useSnapshot.description:
Determines the behavior when reset is executed.
Note: This property is only relevant if no variant management is used, and the filter bar is not used in the advanced mode. A snapshot shows the current state of the filter bar, just before the Filters dialog is opened.
  • undefined (default) defines the standard behavior: snapshot will be applied after reset was triggered
  • false defines that the snapshot will not be applied
  • trueis not considered at all

defaultIndent.helpDescription: Optional. Defines default for the whole Grid numbers of empty columns before the current span begins. It can be defined for large, medium and small screens. Allowed values are separated by space Letters L, M or S followed by number of columns from 0 to 11 that the container has to take, for example: "L2 M4 S6", "M11", "s10" or "l4 m4". Note that the parameters has to be provided in the order large medium small.
defaultIndent.description: Optional. Defines default for the whole Grid numbers of empty columns before the current span begins. It can be defined for large, medium and small screens. Allowed values are separated by space Letters L, M or S followed by number of columns from 0 to 11 that the container has to take, for example: "L2 M4 S6", "M11", "s10" or "l4 m4". Note that the parameters has to be provided in the order large medium small.

liveMode.helpDescription:
If set the search will be automatically triggered, when a filter value was set via the change event.
Note: The liveMode only operates on non-mobile scenarios.
Additionally, if liveMode is set, the following applies:
  • The error messagebox is not displayed, and the showMessages property is ignored.
  • The search is triggered after a variant has been selected.
  • Execute on Select for VariantManagement is not shown and not taken into account

busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

Therefore, this must only be enabled for OData service entities that support basic search.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. defaultSpan.helpDescription: Optional. A string type that represents Grid's default span values for large, medium and small screens for the whole Grid. Note that the parameters has to be provided in the order large medium small.

useDateRangeType.helpDescription: If set to true all date fields with filter restriction interval will be treated as DateTimeRange filters. The useDateRangeType can be set only once during initialization. Note: If this property is set to true and any date filters with filter restriction interval were stored as part of a variant, the values of these filters cannot be applied. If this property is set to false, any previously stored filters which were treated as type DateTimeRange based on the former setting, cannot be converted back to the standard date interval.

  • the property groupLabel will be handled internally and will be ignored, if set
  • the property partOfCurrentVariant has to be set to true

sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBa.helpDescription:
The SmartFilterBar control uses the OData metadata of an entity in order to create a FilterBar.
Whether a field is visible on the FilterBar, supports type-ahead and value help, for example, is automatically determined. When you use control configurations and group configurations it is possible to configure the FilterBar and adapt it according to your needs.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBa.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartfilterbar/SmartFilterBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEntityType entityType} : string
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getResourceUri resourceUri} : string
    • {@link #getBasicSearchFieldName basicSearchFieldName} : string
    • {@link #getEnableBasicSearch enableBasicSearch} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getLiveMode liveMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowMessages showMessages} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getConsiderAnalyticalParameters considerAnalyticalParameters} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getUseDateRangeType useDateRangeType} : boolean
    • {@link #getSuppressSelection suppressSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getConsiderSelectionVariants considerSelectionVariants} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getDefaultSelectionVariantName defaultSelectionVariantName} : string
    • {@link #getUseProvidedNavigationProperties useProvidedNavigationProperties} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getNavigationProperties navigationProperties} : string (default: )
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getControlConfiguration controlConfiguration} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.ControlConfiguration[]
    • {@link #getGroupConfiguration groupConfiguration} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.GroupConfiguration[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSmartVariant smartVariant} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagement)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:pendingChange pendingChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar#constructor sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar} can be used as well.

The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartAreaMic.helpDescription:
The SmartAreaMicroChart control creates a AreaMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which Micro Area Chart UI will be generated; it can also be used to fetch the actual chart data.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialised.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

prefetchNavigationTargets.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.42.0 The property prefetchNavigationTargets is obsolete as navigation targets are determined automatically. The SmartLink controls are re-rendered as soon as the asynchronous determination of navigation targets has been completed.
If set to true, the SemanticObjectController will retrieve all navigation targets once and will disable links for which no targets were found. Setting this value to true will trigger an additional roundtrip.

contactAnnotationPaths.helpDescription: Navigation property that points from the current to the related entity type where the com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1.Contact annotation is defined, for example, '\{"Supplier":"to_Supplier", "CompanyName":"to_Company"\}' . sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectCon.helpDescription: The SemanticObjectController control operates as a single entry point for SmartLink controls created automatically by {@link sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable SmartTable} control, {@link sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart SmartChart} control, {@link sap.ui.comp.smartform.SmartForm SmartForm} control and {@link sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField SmartField} control based on OData metadata. Additionally, all events provided by the SmartLink control are registered by the SemanticObjectController and can be consumed there in a single place. As usual, the SemanticObjectController can be defined within the XML view as well as in the code.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectCon.description: The SemanticObjectController control operates as a single entry point for SmartLink controls created automatically by {@link sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable SmartTable} control, {@link sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart SmartChart} control, {@link sap.ui.comp.smartform.SmartForm SmartForm} control and {@link sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField SmartField} control based on OData metadata. Additionally, all events provided by the SmartLink control are registered by the SemanticObjectController and can be consumed there in a single place. As usual, the SemanticObjectController can be defined within the XML view as well as in the code.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectCon.constructorDescription:
Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getIgnoredFields ignoredFields} : string
    • {@link #getPrefetchNavigationTargets prefetchNavigationTargets} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFieldSemanticObjectMap fieldSemanticObjectMap} : object
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getContactAnnotationPaths contactAnnotationPaths} : object
    • {@link #getEnableAvailableActionsPersonalization enableAvailableActionsPersonalization} : object
    • {@link #getMapFieldToSemanticObject mapFieldToSemanticObject} : boolean
  • Events
    • {@link #event:navigationTargetsObtained navigationTargetsObtained} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforePopoverOpens beforePopoverOpens} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:navigate navigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:prefetchDone prefetchDone} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

useSnapshot.helpDescription:
Determines the behavior when reset is executed.
Note: This property is only relevant if no variant management is used, and the filter bar is not used in the advanced mode. A snapshot shows the current state of the filter bar, just before the Filters dialog is opened.
  • undefined (default) defines the standard behavior: snapshot will be applied after reset was triggered
  • false defines that the snapshot will not be applied
  • trueis not considered at all

sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar.helpDescription:
The control displays filters in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The FilterBar consists of a row containing the {@link sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement VariantManagement} control, the related buttons, and an area underneath displaying the filters. The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The area containing the filters can be hidden or shown using the Hide FilterBar / Show FilterBar button. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Filters button shows the filter dialog.
In this dialog, the consumer has full control over the FilterBar. The filters in this dialog are displayed in one column and organized in groups. The filter items of the filterItems aggregation are grouped in the Basic group . Each filter can be marked as visible in the FilterBar by selecting Add to FilterBar. In addition, the items in the filterGroupItems aggregation can be marked as part of the current variant. The FilterBar also supports a different UI layout when used inside a value help dialog. In this case the FilterBar consists of two logical areas, one containing the general search button and one the Advanced Search area. The Advanced Search is a collapsible area displaying the advanced filters in two columns.

The area containing the filters can be hidden or shown using the Hide FilterBar / Show FilterBar button. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Filters button shows the filter dialog.

sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FilterBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getPersistencyKey persistencyKey} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getAdvancedMode advancedMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getExpandAdvancedArea expandAdvancedArea} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSearchEnabled searchEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFilterBarExpanded filterBarExpanded} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getConsiderGroupTitle considerGroupTitle} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowClearButton showClearButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowRestoreButton showRestoreButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowGoOnFB showGoOnFB} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowRestoreOnFB showRestoreOnFB} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowClearOnFB showClearOnFB} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowGoButton showGoButton} : boolean
    • {@link #getDeltaVariantMode deltaVariantMode} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFilterContainerWidth filterContainerWidth} : string (default: 12rem)
    • {@link #getUseToolbar useToolbar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeader header} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getShowFilterConfiguration showFilterConfiguration} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUseSnapshot useSnapshot} : boolean
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getFilterItems filterItems} : sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterItem[]
    • {@link #getFilterGroupItems filterGroupItems} : sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterGroupItem[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getBasicSearch basicSearch} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.SearchField)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:cancel cancel} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:reset reset} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeVariantSave beforeVariantSave} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeVariantFetch beforeVariantFetch} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantLoad afterVariantLoad} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:filterChange filterChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:clear clear} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialise initialise} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantSave afterVariantSave} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:filtersDialogClosed filtersDialogClosed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:filtersDialogBeforeOpen filtersDialogBeforeOpen} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:filtersDialogCancel filtersDialogCancel} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:filtersDialogSearch filtersDialogSearch} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:filtersDialogSearchForFilters filtersDialogSearchForFilters} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:assignedFiltersChanged assignedFiltersChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.layout.Grid#constructor sap.ui.layout.Grid} can be used as well.

sap.ui.comp.variants.EditableVariantItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new variants/EditableVariantItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getKey key} : string
    • {@link #getGlobal global} : boolean
    • {@link #getLifecyclePackage lifecyclePackage} : string
    • {@link #getLifecycleTransportId lifecycleTransportId} : string
    • {@link #getNamespace namespace} : string
    • {@link #getReadOnly readOnly} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAccessOptions accessOptions} : string
    • {@link #getLabelReadOnly labelReadOnly} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAuthor author} : string
    • {@link #getFavorite favorite} : boolean (default: false)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.ColumnListItem#constructor sap.m.ColumnListItem} can be used as well.

expandNavigationProperties.helpDescription:
Indicates if entities related to navigation properties inside the metadata are requested. If set to true, then these related entities are loaded with an $expand request. Annotations that can have navigation properties are the following:
  • com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text for text arrangements
  • Org.OData.Measures.V1.Unit and Org.OData.Measures.V1.ISOCurrency for units
  • com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.FieldControl for field control
Note: Independent of the fetchValueListReadOnly value, setting this flag to true requests data from the backend. Note: The backend request to expand the navigation properties is sent only if the entity to which SmartField is bound is persisted. For transient entities, there is no backend request since no such data is available.

If the value list is not fetched by the read-only SmartField control, the application has to make sure that the description is requested and made available, for example, by using $expand. In this case the SmartField control will display the description if the path to the description has been set using the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation. sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField.helpDescription:
The SmartField control is a wrapper for other controls. It interprets OData metadata to determine the control that has to be instantiated. The OData entity is derived from the control's binding context. The OData entity's property that is changed or displayed with the control is derived from the control's value property. Note: For interoperability and accessibility reasons, the SmartField control must be labeled by the sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartLabel control instead of the sap.m.Label control, as the sap.m.Label control does not know of the inner structure of a SmartField control. If the SmartField control is rendered inside a smart container control, for example, the SmartForm control, the SmartLabel control is automatically generated to reduce the amount of code needed on the application side. However, in other scenarios when SmartField is used stand-alone or outside a smart container control, for example, a SimpleForm control, the SmartLabel control is not automatically generated in these cases. Although the sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartLabel is a private/internal control, the following basic use is allowed by applications for labeling the SmartField control. XML Example of a SmartField control labeled by a SmartLabel control 
<sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartLabel labelFor="IDProduct"/>
<sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField id="IDProduct" value="{ProductId}"/>
Note: By default, the com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement annotation and the value of the displayBehaviour property of the aggregation named configuration are not evaluated in edit mode. To enable these features, set the {@link #textInEditModeSource} property to a non-default value.
sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField.description:
The SmartField control is a wrapper for other controls. It interprets OData metadata to determine the control that has to be instantiated. The OData entity is derived from the control's binding context. The OData entity's property that is changed or displayed with the control is derived from the control's value property. Note: For interoperability and accessibility reasons, the SmartField control must be labeled by the sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartLabel control instead of the sap.m.Label control, as the sap.m.Label control does not know of the inner structure of a SmartField control. If the SmartField control is rendered inside a smart container control, for example, the SmartForm control, the SmartLabel control is automatically generated to reduce the amount of code needed on the application side. However, in other scenarios when SmartField is used stand-alone or outside a smart container control, for example, a SimpleForm control, the SmartLabel control is not automatically generated in these cases. Although the sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartLabel is a private/internal control, the following basic use is allowed by applications for labeling the SmartField control. XML Example of a SmartField control labeled by a SmartLabel control 
<sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartLabel labelFor="IDProduct"/>
<sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField id="IDProduct" value="{ProductId}"/>
Note: By default, the com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.TextArrangement annotation and the value of the displayBehaviour property of the aggregation named configuration are not evaluated in edit mode. To enable these features, set the {@link #textInEditModeSource} property to a non-default value.

ariaLabelledBy.helpDescription: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).
ariaLabelledBy.description: Association to controls / IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getValue value} : any
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getContextEditable contextEditable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: )
    • {@link #getTextAlign textAlign} : sap.ui.core.TextAlign (default: Initial)
    • {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getName name} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getValueStateText valueStateText} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getShowValueStateMessage showValueStateMessage} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getJsontype jsontype} : sap.ui.comp.smartfield.JSONType
    • {@link #getMandatory mandatory} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMaxLength maxLength} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getShowSuggestion showSuggestion} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowValueHelp showValueHelp} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowLabel showLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getTextLabel textLabel} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getTooltipLabel tooltipLabel} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getUomVisible uomVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUomEditable uomEditable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUomEnabled uomEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUrl url} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getUomEditState uomEditState} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getControlContext controlContext} : sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ControlContextType (default: None)
    • {@link #getProposedControl proposedControl} : sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ControlProposalType (default: None)
    • {@link #getWrapping wrapping} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getClientSideMandatoryCheck clientSideMandatoryCheck} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFetchValueListReadOnly fetchValueListReadOnly} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getExpandNavigationProperties expandNavigationProperties} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTextInEditModeSource textInEditModeSource} : sap.ui.comp.smartfield.TextInEditModeSource (default: None)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getConfiguration configuration} : sap.ui.comp.smartfield.Configuration
    • {@link #getControlProposal controlProposal} : sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ControlProposal
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectController semanticObjectController} : sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:entitySetFound entitySetFound} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialise initialise} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:visibleChanged visibleChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:editableChanged editableChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:contextEditableChanged contextEditableChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:innerControlsCreated innerControlsCreated} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:valueListChanged valueListChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

requestAtLeastFields.helpDescription:
CSV of fields that must be always requested by the backend system.
This property is mainly meant to be used if there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters. Also, setting this property during runtime, will delete the current drill-stack and lead to a loss of the drill history.

useListForChartTypeSelection.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.48.0 Setting the property to false will have no effect on the visualization of chart type selection anymore. SmartChart will always show a list of chart types, regardless of how many are available.
Controls the visualization for chart type selection. If set to true, the list of available chart types will be displayed. If set to false and there are three or fewer available chart types, the chart types will be displayed as separate buttons in the toolbar. If there are more than three chart types, a list will be shown.

sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart.helpDescription:
The SmartChart control creates a chart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet property must be specified to use the control. This property is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which the chart UI will be generated. It can also be used to fetch the actual chart data.
Based on the chartType property, this control will render the corresponding chart.
Note: Most of the attributes are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart.description:
The SmartChart control creates a chart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet property must be specified to use the control. This property is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which the chart UI will be generated. It can also be used to fetch the actual chart data.
Based on the chartType property, this control will render the corresponding chart.
Note: Most of the attributes are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

smartVariant.helpDescription: Identifies the SmartVariant control which should be used for the personalization. Will be ignored if the advanced mode is set.
smartVariant.description: Identifies the SmartVariant control which should be used for the personalization. Will be ignored if the advanced mode is set.

sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartchart/SmartChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getSmartFilterId smartFilterId} : string
    • {@link #getIgnoredFields ignoredFields} : string
    • {@link #getRequestAtLeastFields requestAtLeastFields} : string
    • {@link #getIgnoreFromPersonalisation ignoreFromPersonalisation} : string
    • {@link #getChartType chartType} : string
    • {@link #getIgnoredChartTypes ignoredChartTypes} : string
    • {@link #getUseVariantManagement useVariantManagement} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUseChartPersonalisation useChartPersonalisation} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeader header} : string
    • {@link #getPersistencyKey persistencyKey} : string
    • {@link #getCurrentVariantId currentVariantId} : string
    • {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getChartBindingPath chartBindingPath} : string
    • {@link #getShowDrillButtons showDrillButtons} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowZoomButtons showZoomButtons} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowSemanticNavigationButton showSemanticNavigationButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowVariantManagement showVariantManagement} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowDownloadButton showDownloadButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowDetailsButton showDetailsButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowDrillBreadcrumbs showDrillBreadcrumbs} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowChartTooltip showChartTooltip} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowLegendButton showLegendButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLegendVisible legendVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSelectionMode selectionMode} : sap.chart.SelectionMode (default: Multi)
    • {@link #getShowFullScreenButton showFullScreenButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUseTooltip useTooltip} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUseListForChartTypeSelection useListForChartTypeSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowChartTypeSelectionButton showChartTypeSelectionButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getNoData noData} : string
    • {@link #getShowToolbar showToolbar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getToolbarStyle toolbarStyle} : sap.m.ToolbarStyle
    • {@link #getShowDimensionsTitle showDimensionsTitle} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowMeasuresTitle showMeasuresTitle} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getToolbar toolbar} : sap.m.Toolbar
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectController semanticObjectController} : sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController
    • {@link #getSelectionDetailsItemActions selectionDetailsItemActions} : sap.ui.core.Item[]
    • {@link #getSelectionDetailsActions selectionDetailsActions} : sap.ui.core.Item[]
    • {@link #getSelectionDetailsActionGroups selectionDetailsActionGroups} : sap.ui.core.Item[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSmartVariant smartVariant} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:initialise initialise} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeRebindChart beforeRebindChart} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:dataReceived dataReceived} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantInitialise afterVariantInitialise} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantSave afterVariantSave} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantApply afterVariantApply} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showOverlay showOverlay} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:fullScreenToggled fullScreenToggled} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectionDetailsActionPress selectionDetailsActionPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:chartDataChanged chartDataChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.VBox#constructor sap.m.VBox} can be used as well.

sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartBulletM.helpDescription:
The SmartBulletMicroChart control creates a sap.suite.ui.microchart.BulletMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the given default OData model. Based on this, the BulletMicroChart UI is created.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartBulletM.description:
The SmartBulletMicroChart control creates a sap.suite.ui.microchart.BulletMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the given default OData model. Based on this, the BulletMicroChart UI is created.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

chartTitle.helpDescription: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the Title property of the Chart annotation. Title property of the DataPoint annotation is ignored.
chartTitle.description: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the Title property of the Chart annotation. Title property of the DataPoint annotation is ignored.

unitOfMeasure.helpDescription: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the Unit of Measure. The Value property of the DataPoint annotation should be annotated with this Unit of Measure. It can be either ISOCurrency or Unit from the OData Measures annotations.
unitOfMeasure.description: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the Unit of Measure. The Value property of the DataPoint annotation should be annotated with this Unit of Measure. It can be either ISOCurrency or Unit from the OData Measures annotations.

gridDataSpan.helpDescription:
A string type that represents Grid's span values for large, medium and small screens. Allowed values are separated by space Letters L, M or S followed by number of columns from 1 to 12 that the container has to take, for example: "L2 M4 S6", "M12", "s10" or "l4 m4". Note that the parameters has to be provided in the order large medium small.
The value set here will be set to all group elements when used with horizontal layout (SmartForm property useHorizontalLayout)

sap.ui.comp.smartform.Layout.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartform/Layout. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getLabelSpanXL labelSpanXL} : int
    • {@link #getLabelSpanL labelSpanL} : int
    • {@link #getLabelSpanM labelSpanM} : int
    • {@link #getLabelSpanS labelSpanS} : int
    • {@link #getEmptySpanXL emptySpanXL} : int
    • {@link #getEmptySpanL emptySpanL} : int
    • {@link #getEmptySpanM emptySpanM} : int
    • {@link #getEmptySpanS emptySpanS} : int
    • {@link #getColumnsXL columnsXL} : int
    • {@link #getColumnsL columnsL} : int
    • {@link #getColumnsM columnsM} : int
    • {@link #getSingleGroupFullSize singleGroupFullSize} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getBreakpointXL breakpointXL} : int
    • {@link #getBreakpointL breakpointL} : int
    • {@link #getBreakpointM breakpointM} : int
    • {@link #getGridDataSpan gridDataSpan} : sap.ui.layout.GridSpan (default: )
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantMa.helpDescription:
The SmartVariantManagement control is a specialization of the {@link sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement VariantManagement} control and communicates with the layer that offers SAPUI5 flexibility services to manage the variants.
For more information about SAPUI5 flexibility, refer to the Developer Guide.
sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantMa.description:
The SmartVariantManagement control is a specialization of the {@link sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement VariantManagement} control and communicates with the layer that offers SAPUI5 flexibility services to manage the variants.
For more information about SAPUI5 flexibility, refer to the Developer Guide.
sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantMa.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new SmartVariantManagement.
The call sequence is as follows:
A control for which personalization is used has to be registered first via the personalizableControls association. Then it has to call the initialise method with the arguments fCallback function which will be called once the personalization data has been retrieved and oPersoControl, the control itself.
Note: the function callback has to be defined in the personalizable control.
The old behavior, where the control has to register to the initialise event, before the initialise method call, should not be used any longer and is not supported at all for the page variant scenarios. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getPersistencyKey persistencyKey} : string
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getPersonalizableControls personalizableControls} : sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.PersonalizableInfo[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:initialise initialise} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterSave afterSave} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement#constructor sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement} can be used as well.

initiallyVisibleFields.helpDescription:
CSV of fields that must be shown initially in the SmartTable as visible columns and in the order specified.
This property is mainly meant to be used when no LineItem annotation exists.
If you have fields in the XMLView they are always shown first; then, the columns are added based on the LineItem annotation and finally based on this property.
Note:
If both this property and the LineItem annotation exist, the order of fields cannot be guaranteed to be as mentioned here.
No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

enableCustomFilter.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.40.0 After personalization dialog has been introduced in SmartTable the property enableCustomFilter does not make sense. When setting the property to false, the entered custom filter value will not be shown in personalization dialog and will also not be persisted in variant management. The custom filter will also be overwritten when rebindTable is called on the SmartTable.
Can be used to override the filter behavior. If set to true (default), instead of the filter input box a button is rendered. When pressing this button, the SmartTable control opens the filter panel directly in the table personalization dialog.

The control is shown, in case there is no data for the Table available. In case of a string value this will simply replace the no data text.
Currently the Responsive Table only supports string values.

sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable.helpDescription:
The SmartTable control creates a table based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which columns will be generated; it can also be used to fetch the actual table data.
Based on the tableType property, this control will render a standard, analytical, tree, or responsive table.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable.description:
The SmartTable control creates a table based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which columns will be generated; it can also be used to fetch the actual table data.
Based on the tableType property, this control will render a standard, analytical, tree, or responsive table.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

smartVariant.helpDescription: Identifies the SmartVariant control which should be used for the personalization. Will be ignored if the advanced mode is set.
smartVariant.description: Identifies the SmartVariant control which should be used for the personalization. Will be ignored if the advanced mode is set.

sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smarttable/SmartTable. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getSmartFilterId smartFilterId} : string
    • {@link #getIgnoredFields ignoredFields} : string
    • {@link #getInitiallyVisibleFields initiallyVisibleFields} : string
    • {@link #getRequestAtLeastFields requestAtLeastFields} : string
    • {@link #getIgnoreFromPersonalisation ignoreFromPersonalisation} : string
    • {@link #getTableType tableType} : sap.ui.comp.smarttable.TableType
    • {@link #getUseVariantManagement useVariantManagement} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowVariantManagement showVariantManagement} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUseExportToExcel useExportToExcel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getExportType exportType} : sap.ui.comp.smarttable.ExportType (default: UI5Client)
    • {@link #getUseTablePersonalisation useTablePersonalisation} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowTablePersonalisation showTablePersonalisation} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowRowCount showRowCount} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeader header} : string
    • {@link #getToolbarStyleClass toolbarStyleClass} : string
    • {@link #getEnableCustomFilter enableCustomFilter} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getPersistencyKey persistencyKey} : string
    • {@link #getUseOnlyOneSolidToolbar useOnlyOneSolidToolbar} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getCurrentVariantId currentVariantId} : string
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTableBindingPath tableBindingPath} : string
    • {@link #getEditTogglable editTogglable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getDemandPopin demandPopin} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowFullScreenButton showFullScreenButton} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getCustomToolbar customToolbar} : sap.m.Toolbar
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectController semanticObjectController} : sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController
    • {@link #getNoData noData} : sap.ui.core.Control|string
    • {@link #getSemanticKeyAdditionalControl semanticKeyAdditionalControl} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSmartVariant smartVariant} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:initialise initialise} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeRebindTable beforeRebindTable} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:editToggled editToggled} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:dataRequested dataRequested} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:dataReceived dataReceived} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantInitialise afterVariantInitialise} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantSave afterVariantSave} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantApply afterVariantApply} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showOverlay showOverlay} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:fieldChange fieldChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:fullScreenToggled fullScreenToggled} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeExport beforeExport} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.VBox#constructor sap.m.VBox} can be used as well.

sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.ControlConfig.helpDescription: ControlConfiguration can be used to add additional configuration for filter fields in the SmartFilterBar control, in order to overwrite the default settings from the OData metadata. For instance, it is possible to change the label, index or control type of a filter field.
sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.ControlConfig.description: ControlConfiguration can be used to add additional configuration for filter fields in the SmartFilterBar control, in order to overwrite the default settings from the OData metadata. For instance, it is possible to change the label, index or control type of a filter field.
sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.ControlConfig.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartfilterbar/ControlConfiguration. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getKey key} : string
    • {@link #getGroupId groupId} : string
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHasValueHelpDialog hasValueHelpDialog} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getControlType controlType} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.ControlType (default: auto)
    • {@link #getFilterType filterType} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.FilterType (default: auto)
    • {@link #getIndex index} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getHasTypeAhead hasTypeAhead} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMandatory mandatory} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.MandatoryType (default: auto)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : string
    • {@link #getVisibleInAdvancedArea visibleInAdvancedArea} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getPreventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog preventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDisplayBehaviour displayBehaviour} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.DisplayBehaviour (default: auto)
    • {@link #getConditionType conditionType} : any
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getDefaultFilterValues defaultFilterValues} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SelectOption[]
    • {@link #getCustomControl customControl} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

useHorizontalLayout.helpDescription: Specifies whether the groups shall be rendered in a ResponsiveLayout with label on top of the group element. Each group will be rendered in a new line. Note: If Group is assigned to a SmartForm control, this property is inherited from the SmartForm control. So don't set it to a different value from the one in the SmartForm control. For performance reasons it might make sense to set it manually to the same value as the one in the SmartForm control when creating the GroupElement element.

label.helpDescription: Label of the fields. Can either be a Label control or a string. If a Label control is used, the properties of the Label can be set. In this case the Label is assigned to the fields of the FormElement.

The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartRadialM.helpDescription:
The SmartRadialMicroChart control creates a sap.suite.ui.microchart.RadialMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the given default OData model. Based on this, the RadialMicroChart UI is created.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartRadialM.description:
The SmartRadialMicroChart control creates a sap.suite.ui.microchart.RadialMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the given default OData model. Based on this, the RadialMicroChart UI is created.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

chartTitle.helpDescription: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the Title property of the Chart annotation. Title property of the DataPoint annotation is ignored.

sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartRadialM.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartRadialMicroChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getChartType chartType} : string (default: Donut)
    • {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getChartBindingPath chartBindingPath} : string
    • {@link #getIsResponsive isResponsive} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
  • Associations
    • {@link #getChartTitle chartTitle} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getChartDescription chartDescription} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getUnitOfMeasure unitOfMeasure} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getFreeText freeText} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:initialize initialize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.show:
type: function, description: This callback function shows the actual navigation popover. If the navigationTargetsObtained has been registered, the show function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover. Signatures: show()
  • show(oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.
  • show(sMainNavigationId, oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
    • {string | undefined} sMainNavigationId The visible description for the main navigation link. With '', both the description and subtitle will be removed. With undefined, the description is calculated using the binding context of a given source object (for example SmartLink control).
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
    • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
    • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.
eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.actions: type: [object Object][], description: Array of available navigation target objects.
eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.ownNavigatio: type: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData, description: The navigation object for the own application. This navigation option is by default not visible on the popover.

sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantMa.helpDescription: Handles the odata metadata based information. An instance of this class will be created and used by the {@link sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagement SmartVariantManagement} control. The adapter transforms odata metadata based SelectionPresentationVariant information to UIState object. For each SelectionPresentationVariant annotation an entry will be added to the VariantManagement control. It will be called by the SmartVariantManagement whenever the user selects the corresponding entry and will provide a valid {@link sap.ui.comp.state.UIState UIState} object.

sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement.helpDescription: The VariantManagement control can be used to manage variants, such as filter bar variants or table variants.
sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement.description: The VariantManagement control can be used to manage variants, such as filter bar variants or table variants.
sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new VariantManagement. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getInitialSelectionKey initialSelectionKey} : string
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDefaultVariantKey defaultVariantKey} : string
    • {@link #getSelectionKey selectionKey} : string
    • {@link #getShowCreateTile showCreateTile} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowExecuteOnSelection showExecuteOnSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowShare showShare} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowSetAsDefault showSetAsDefault} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLifecycleSupport lifecycleSupport} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getStandardItemText standardItemText} : string
    • {@link #getIndustrySolutionMode industrySolutionMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getUseFavorites useFavorites} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getInErrorState inErrorState} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.core.Item[] (default)
    • {@link #getVariantItems variantItems} : sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantItem[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:save save} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:manage manage} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

presentationVariant.helpDescription:
Object representing the presentation variant. The structure looks like: 

{
	ContextUrl: {string},
	MaxItems: {int},
 SortOrder: [],
	GroupBy: [],
	Total: [],
	RequestAtLeast: [],
	Visualizations: []
}
Note:
  • PresentationVariantID property is not provided
  • Text property is not provided because it is translated text
  • TotalBy is not supported yet
  • IncludeGrandTotal is not supported yet
  • InitialExpansionLevel is not supported yet
  • Title of Visualizations.Content property is not provided because it is translated text
  • Description of Visualizations.Content property is not provided because it is translated text
  • VariantName property is not part of specified DataSuiteFormat yet

If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.comp.smartform.SmartForm.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartform/SmartForm. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getUseHorizontalLayout useHorizontalLayout} : boolean
    • {@link #getHorizontalLayoutGroupElementMinWidth horizontalLayoutGroupElementMinWidth} : int
    • {@link #getCheckButton checkButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEntityType entityType} : string
    • {@link #getExpandable expandable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getExpanded expanded} : boolean
    • {@link #getEditTogglable editTogglable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIgnoredFields ignoredFields} : string
    • {@link #getFlexEnabled flexEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGroups groups} : sap.ui.comp.smartform.Group[] (default)
    • {@link #getLayout layout} : sap.ui.comp.smartform.Layout
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectController semanticObjectController} : sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController
    • {@link #getCustomToolbar customToolbar} : sap.m.Toolbar
  • Events
    • {@link #event:editToggled editToggled} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:checked checked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Field.helpDescription:
The SmartMultiEdit.Field control enables you to edit multiple homogeneous objects simultaneously. It allows you to select a predefined item from a combo box and apply your selection to all objects being edited.
In addition, SmartMultiEdit.Field can handle metadata for a specific OData property when you need to enable mass editing for multiple contexts. The contexts are handled by the {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Container} control.

The SmartMultiEdit.Field control enables you to edit multiple homogeneous objects simultaneously. It allows you to select a predefined item from a combo box and apply your selection to all objects being edited.
In addition, SmartMultiEdit.Field can handle metadata for a specific OData property when you need to enable mass editing for multiple contexts. The contexts are handled by the {@link sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Container} control.
sap.ui.comp.smartmultiedit.Field.constructorDescription:

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Control#constructor sap.m.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroCh.helpDescription:
The SmartMicroChart control creates a chart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings. The entitySet property must be specified in order to use the control. This property is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the given default OData model. Depending on the UI/ChartType annotation, the control creates a corresponding SmartAreaMicroChart, SmartBulletMicroChart or SmartRadialMicroChart instance and delegates to the internal control.
Note: Most of the attributes are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroCh.description:
The SmartMicroChart control creates a chart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings. The entitySet property must be specified in order to use the control. This property is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the given default OData model. Depending on the UI/ChartType annotation, the control creates a corresponding SmartAreaMicroChart, SmartBulletMicroChart or SmartRadialMicroChart instance and delegates to the internal control.
Note: Most of the attributes are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

chartTitle.helpDescription: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the Title property of the Chart annotation. Title property of the DataPoint annotation is ignored.
chartTitle.description: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the Title property of the Chart annotation. Title property of the DataPoint annotation is ignored.

freeText.helpDescription: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the free text provided by annotations. The Value property of the DataPoint annotation should be annotated with this free text. As of 1.42.0, this association is only available for chart type 'Donut'.
freeText.description: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the free text provided by annotations. The Value property of the DataPoint annotation should be annotated with this free text. As of 1.42.0, this association is only available for chart type 'Donut'.

unitOfMeasure.helpDescription: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the Unit of Measure. The Value property of the DataPoint annotation should be annotated with this Unit of Measure. It can be either ISOCurrency or Unit from the OData Measures annotations.
unitOfMeasure.description: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the Unit of Measure. The Value property of the DataPoint annotation should be annotated with this Unit of Measure. It can be either ISOCurrency or Unit from the OData Measures annotations.

chartDescription.helpDescription: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the Description property of the Chart annotation. Description property of the DataPoint annotation is ignored.
chartDescription.description: If the associated control is provided, its text property is set to the Description property of the Chart annotation. Description property of the DataPoint annotation is ignored.

sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroCh.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getShowLabel showLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getChartBindingPath chartBindingPath} : string
    • {@link #getChartType chartType} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 164px)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 74px)
    • {@link #getIsResponsive isResponsive} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
  • Associations
    • {@link #getChartTitle chartTitle} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getChartDescription chartDescription} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getUnitOfMeasure unitOfMeasure} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getFreeText freeText} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:initialize initialize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAvailableActions availableActions} : sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[]

    • {@link #event:availableActionsPersonalizationPress availableActionsPersonalizationPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.comp.smartlist.SmartList.helpDescription:
A smart control to simplify using the sap.m.List and sap.m.Tree controls in list patterns.

Overview

The SmartList control creates a list or tree based on the configuration specified. There is, however, a difference to other smart controls: This control does not use annotations to automatically create its content. Hence, a template must always be provided for this control.

Structure

The SmartList control consists of the following elements:
  • OverflowToolbar control: Displays the header and other action buttons. Users can add their own toolbar and buttons in the view.
  • List or Tree control: The actual list/tree control. Users can also add this in the view with the required configuration.
The entitySet property must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch the actual data.
The listItemTemplate aggregation must also be specified with the required item template, such as StandardListItem/StandardTreeItem, which will be used during binding.

Note:

Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

Overview

The SmartList control creates a list or tree based on the configuration specified. There is, however, a difference to other smart controls: This control does not use annotations to automatically create its content. Hence, a template must always be provided for this control.

Structure

The SmartList control consists of the following elements:
  • OverflowToolbar control: Displays the header and other action buttons. Users can add their own toolbar and buttons in the view.
  • List or Tree control: The actual list/tree control. Users can also add this in the view with the required configuration.
The entitySet property must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch the actual data.
The listItemTemplate aggregation must also be specified with the required item template, such as StandardListItem/StandardTreeItem, which will be used during binding.

Note:

Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

sap.ui.comp.smartlist.SmartList.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartlist/SmartList. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getSelectFields selectFields} : string
    • {@link #getExpandFields expandFields} : string
    • {@link #getShowRowCount showRowCount} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeader header} : string
    • {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getListBindingPath listBindingPath} : string
    • {@link #getListType listType} : sap.ui.comp.smartlist.ListType
    • {@link #getShowFullScreenButton showFullScreenButton} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getListItemTemplate listItemTemplate} : sap.m.ListItemBase
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSmartFilter smartFilter} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:initialise initialise} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeRebindList beforeRebindList} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:dataReceived dataReceived} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.VBox#constructor sap.m.VBox} can be used as well.

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData.helpDescription:
Stores display text together with a navigation target hyperlink.
The LinkData class is used by {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink SmartLink} and {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController SemanticObjectController} to define the visible links on {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover NavigationPopover}.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData.description:
Stores display text together with a navigation target hyperlink.
The LinkData class is used by {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink SmartLink} and {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController SemanticObjectController} to define the visible links on {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover NavigationPopover}.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new navpopover/LinkData. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getHref href} : string
    • {@link #getTarget target} : string
    • {@link #getDescription description} : string (default: undefined)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getKey key} : string (default: undefined)
    • {@link #getPress press} : object
    • {@link #getIsSuperiorAction isSuperiorAction} : boolean
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
